data.name: LDF_SymbolDefintionReferenceNotFound
data.value: The Layer Definition contains a Composite Rule pointing to a non-existent Symbol Definition: {0}

data.name: LDF_SymbolParameterOverrideToNonExistentParameter
data.value: The Layer Definition specifies a parameter override for {0} that does not exist ({1})

data.name: LDF_IrrelevantUsageContext
data.value: Referenced Symbol Definition {0} has an irrelevant usage context for this layer because this layer does not have features of type: {1}

data.name: ERR_PROPERTY_VALUE_NOT_OF_TYPE
data.value: The specified property {0} is not of type: {1}

data.name: MDF_LayerWithNullExtent
data.value: Map Definition references feature source {0} which has a null extent. Most likely caused by feature source having no actual data inside it

data.name: TS_ThreadFailureError
data.value: All threads crashed, and the tile set was only partially created

data.name: FS_ValidationTimeout
data.value: Maestro could not fully validate the feature source due to a a mapagent error. Assuming it is because of timeout: {0}

data.name: ERR_CLASS_NOT_FOUND
data.value: Class not found: {0}

data.name: ERR_INIT_IDENTITY_PROPS
data.value: Could fetch and initialize identity properties for {1} This is likely a bug in MapGuide {0}{2}

data.name: FS_CannotPackageSecuredCredentials
data.value: Due to a limitation in the public APIs provided by MapGuide. This Feature Source cannot be packaged by Maestro's packager without discarding the MG_USER_CREDENTIALS element. The workaround is to either re-secure these Feature Sources after loading the Maestro-created package, or to use the official packaging method which will preserve MG_USER_CREDENTIALS in its encrypted state

data.name: FS_PlaintextCredentials
data.value: This Feature Source uses plaintext credentials. This would happen if you are using an old version of Maestro (4.0.2 or older). This is not secure as such Feature Sources can be accessed by the Anonymous MapGuide user account. It is strongly advised that such Feature Sources can be re-secured with MapGuide/Infrastructure Studio or with Maestro 4.0.3 (or newer)

data.name: FS_SecuredCredentialTokensWithoutSecuredCredentialData
data.value: Feature source content has the %MG_USERNAME% and %MG_PASSWORD% tokens, but does not have the MG_USER_CREDENTIALS resource data item

data.name: ADF_InvalidWidgetReferenceInContainer
data.value: A non-existent widget by the id of {0} is being referenced from a menu/container : {1}

data.name: ADF_NonUiWidgetAttachedToContainer
data.value: A non-UI widget by the id of {0} is residing in the menu/container ({1}). Being a non-UI widget, this may cause rendering problems for that particular container

data.name: ADF_ReferencedWidgetInMenuHasNoLabel
data.value: A widget by the id of {0} has no label. This may cause display problems in the menu/container ({1}) if there is no icon specified

data.name: FS_EmptyJoinPrefix
data.value: The Extended Feature Class ({0}) is using an empty Join Prefix. A join prefix is used to prevent collisions between property names which may exist in both the primary and joined feature classes.

data.name: FS_PotentialBadJoinPerformance
data.value: The Extended Feature Class ({0}) does not satisfy the required parameters for optimal Feature Join performance (both sides sortable, on a single property). Join Performance may not be optimal. Left-side sortable: {1}, Right-side sortable: {2}

data.name: FS_PotentialBadJoinPerformance2
data.value: The Extended Feature Class ({0}) does not satisfy the required parameters for optimal Feature Join performance (both sides sortable, on a single property). Join Performance may not be optimal.
